N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2700.7 - Denial of access to records

State Regulations
(a) Denial of access to records shall be in
writing stating the reason therefor and advising the requester of the right to
appeal to the individual to hear appeals. (b) If requested records are not provided
promptly, as required in section
2700.2
(b) of this

Part, such failure shall also be deemed a denial of access. (c) The following person shall hear appeals
for denial of access to records under the Freedom of Information Law: The

Public Authorities Control Board. (d) The time for deciding an appeal by the
individual designated to hear appeals shall commence upon receipt of written
appeal identifying: (1)

The date of the
appeal. (2)

The date and location
of the requests for records. (3)

The records to which the requester was denied access. (4)

Whether the denial of access was in
writing or was by failure to provide records promptly as required by section
2700.2
(b) of this

Part. (5)

The name and return
address of the requester. (e) The individual designated to hear appeals
shall inform the requester of his or her decision in writing within seven
business days of receipt of an appeal. (f) A final denial of access to a requested
record, as provided for in subdivision (e) of this section, shall be subject to
court review, as provided for in article 78 of the Civil Practice Law and
